info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 5:34PM AST until April 29 at 8:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Manati, Vega Alta and Vega Baja.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM AST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vega Baja, Manati, Vega Alta, Barceloneta, Ceiba, Coto Norte, Miranda, Monserrate, La Luisa, Brenas, San Antonio, Tierras Nuevas Poniente, Sabana and Tierras Nuevas Pon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AST THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Manati, PR; Vega Alta, PR; Vega Baja, PR
